headline: 2024 presidential contenders weigh in on how Supreme Court leak may impact midterm elections
author: Brooke Singman
sentences: EXCLUSIVE: Potential 2024 presidential hopefuls are weighing in on whether the leaked Supreme Court draft opinion overturning Roe v. Wade will impact the November midterm elections, with some GOP leaders saying it will lead to a red wave, while others are skeptical that it will have a major impact on voters.

BIDEN ON SUPREME COURT LEAK: ROE SHOULD NOT BE OVERTURNED, 'A WOMAN'S RIGHT TO CHOOSE IS FUNDAMENTAL'
The Supreme Court in a statement Tuesday acknowledged that "a copy of a draft opinion in a pending case" was published Monday night and the Supreme Court marshal will be investigating the origin of the leak.

SUPREME COURT CHIEF JUSTICE DIRECTS MARSHAL TO INVESTIGATE LEAK, CALLS OUT 'EGREGIOUS BREACH OF ... TRUST'
Former President Trump told Fox News Digital Tuesday that he does not think the courts ultimate decision will have a "tremendous effect" on Novembers midterm elections.

Former Vice President Pence, an outspoken critic of abortion and pro-life leader, said in a speech ahead of oral arguments in Dobbs that "Nothing has done more to destabilize our society in the last 50 years than legalized abortion on demand."

"I found it very interesting that a knee-jerk reaction of the Democrats was to immediately politicize this and to try to use this to push people to go vote because they did not like what they anticipate will be an action of the court.

Sen. Marsha Blackburn, R-Tenn., told Fox News Digital in an interview that she thinks Democrats "knee-jerk" reaction to politicize the issue of the leaked draft ahead of the midterms is an effort to "energize their base."

But I think when people realize it's not a ban on abortion, that it is simply giving the state the authority that is theirs to decide how they want to address the issue of abortion in their states with their citizens.

President Biden on Tuesday reacted saying in a statement that he believes "a womans right to choose is fundamental," and arguing that "basic fairness and the stability of our law demand that [Roe] not be overturned."
However, some lawmakers are less convinced the Supreme Court's draft decision is as good for Republicans heading into the midterms, and see it as an opportunity for Democrats to rally their own base.
A joint statement on the leaked brief by numerous Democratic campaign arms, including the Democratic National Committee (DNC), states that abortion will be a key campaign issue in the midterms.
Former Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley told Fox News Digital that Republicans will have to "work twice as hard" in the midterms to protect the right to life through elected representatives.

TRUMP: SUPREME COURT LEAK SETS 'DANGEROUS PRECEDENT,' SAYS ISSUE WON'T HAVE 'TREMENDOUS EFFECT' ON MIDTERMS

It will be the former vice president's second trip in a week to South Carolina, a state that holds the first southern primary and votes third in the GOPs presidential nominating calendar.
"At the federal level, we will need more pro-choice Senators and a pro-choice majority in the House to adopt legislation that codifies Roe, which I will work to pass and sign into law."
This is just unprecedented," Blackburn said, also noting that Democrats use "their cheerleaders in the media" to force a change in policy without going through the appropriate channels.
"Although the document described in yesterdays reports is authentic, it does not represent a decision by the Court or the final position of any member on the issues in the case."
A Pence aide told Fox News Digital Tuesday that he plans to address the topic during a pro-life speech at Carolina Pregnancy Center's Spring Gala on Thursday in South Carolina.
Trump, during his presidency, appointed three conservative associate justices to the Supreme Court: Justice Neil Gorsuch, Justice Brett Kavanaugh and Justice Amy Coney Barrett.
Former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo told Fox News in a statement that in light of the leak "now more than ever" conservative leaders need to be elected in the midterms.
Blackburn also said that Republicans going into the midterms must make certain that voters realize that the anticipated Supreme Court decision "does not ban abortion."
A draft opinion written by Justice Samuel Alito that would overturn Roe v. Wade and return the issue of abortion to individual states was leaked to Politico on Monday.

He also said any potential final decision on the case by the high court should push voters "to elect pro-choice officials" during Novembers midterm elections.
In a statement to Fox News Digital, Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, said that the leak will lead to an "utter tsunami" of GOP wins in the upcoming November midterms.
And in November, we must elect Democrats who will serve as the last lines of defense against the GOPs assault on our established and fundamental freedoms.
However, when asked by reporters later Tuesday if the decision would have an effect on the midterms, Biden said: "I haven't thought that through yet."
